p: Naringenin is included in the flavanones group and can be found in citrus and grapes. Its pharmaceutical effects consist of anti-inflammatory, antimutagenic, and anticancer properties [ 111]. Furthermore, it has been reported that naringenin induces apoptosis in various cellular lines, but unfortunately it has poor bioavailability and low aqueous solubility [ 112]. Naringenin inhibits cells proliferation and exerts pro-apoptotic effects in human endometriosis cells, through the depolarization of mitochondrial membrane potential. Moreover, naringenin is able to increase intracellular levels of ROS [ 113].
